data.title: Basic Collaboration
data.body:
There are many possibilities with collaboration. This issue covers a simple case, where one user can invite another user to share their entire workspace. The host will start a session which will copy an identifier to their clipboard. Other people can paste that id to connect to the host and share their session. For now we will assume that the joiners already have a copy of the repository they are joining at a standard location on disk, checked out at the correct location.
- [x] Create concurrently mutable document library
- [x] Share basic pane splits and items peer to peer via copied/pasted guid
- [ ] Open a new window when joining a sharing session
- [ ] Share active pane item
- [ ] Make absolute paths relative to repository for sharing on different machines
- [ ] Share buffer contents
- [ ] Share cursor positions in buffers
- [ ] Assign numeric site ids to documents instead of guids

data.title: Copy paste does not work when you select a different keyboard language
data.body:
My OSX has an additional keyboard, Greek. When I am using Atom with Greek selected, copy paste doesn't work.

That is, I select some text, press cmd+c and then cmd+v and nothing happens.

data.title: Indention off when pasting with autoIndentOnPaste: true
Clean up fs-utils
data.body:
- [x] Use `path.join()` instead of `fsUtils.join()`
- [x] Use `path.basename()` instead of `fsUtils.base()`
- [x] Use `path.dirname()` instead of `fsUtils.directory()`
- [x] Use `path.extname()` instead of `fsUtils.extension()`
- [x] Use `rimraf` from `fsUtils.remove()`
- [x] Use 'mkdirp' from `fsUtils.makeTree()`
- [x] Remove unused `split()` and `makeDirectory()` methods.
- [x] Remove `Async` label from async method name
- [x] Add `Sync` to sync method names

Fixes #525  and #530

data.title: Unclosable window after killing helper process
data.body:
I killed a helper process that went crazy (my fault happened during terminal plugin development). This resulted in a grey window like in #577. The windows does not close (tried `cmd-w` and the close icon). Also nothing is showing in the logs.

![screen shot 2013-06-10 at 2 07 23 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/829/631394/d1590e5e-d1c6-11e2-904b-52a5298990c2.png)

data.title: Strange behaviour deleting over character
data.body:
I was editing a file and noticed this wee oddity.

![atom-weird-delete-behaviour](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/296432/629261/bd51c776-d139-11e2-9de1-ce1bce8addcc.gif)

Note that the caret position after backspacing is one column to the left of where it should be. The number of spaces is correct, and the positions correct themselves as soon as you type another character, and that it’s not any special characters either—it’s doing it with (at least) `=` and `#`.

data.title: Too many invisibles
data.body:
I think atom shows too many invisibles. I like seeing returns and tabs, but spaces seems like overkill. Yes it is technically an invisible, but showing it adds a lot of extra visual distraction.

I guess the goal of invisibles is what matters. For me, it has always been to see where I have tabs instead of spaces (somehow, _shutter_), more than seeing everything. I could be wrong, just thought I would put out my expectations for anyone to chew on and/or spit out.

data.title: ERB highlighting relies on HTML, and is inaccurate
data.body:
![screen shot 2013-06-05 at 5 57 42 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/64050/615731/3d5b471a-ce44-11e2-8456-fb1eab6822f1.png)

A quick Google search shoes https://github.com/eddorre/SublimeERB for ERB in TextMate. I think it's important enough to come up with some solution for this. The pink `<` highlighting is one thing, but the attributes are totally different colors, too.

Kinda sucks I've got to override the inline styles to this level. Hopefully there's a way we don't have to set the width of the internal list.

data.title: Support themes inside of packages
data.body: Allow packages to contribute themes.

data.title: Less doesn't auto indent after {
data.body:
Hitting `enter` after a `{` in `.less` files doesn't indent the next row.

http://manual.macromates.com/en/appendix#increase_pattern

This is due to the fact that we aren't loading preferences for bundles with no grammars and also we aren't including [source.tmbundle](https://github.com/textmate/source.tmbundle) which defines an [indent pattern](https://github.com/textmate/source.tmbundle/blob/master/Preferences/Miscellaneous.plist#L8-L14) for the `source` scope.

/cc @orderedlist

data.title: Add initial surrogate pair support
data.body: Break out surrogate pairs as atomic tokens so they can be edited and navigated around.

data.title: Highlight of image row in tree-view only works the first time
data.body: Start Atom, select an image, the row highlights properly. Select any other image, OR select a different file than the original image, and no row highlight appears in the tree view.

data.title: Odd behaviour when backspacing over UTF-8 symbol
data.body:
![atom-utf8-backspace-bug](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/296432/599193/2ff00fc8-cc48-11e2-988c-56b3826a7a6b.gif)

The above GIF shows the following things in a loop:
1. Paste a UTF-8 character (the one found [here](http://www.fileformat.info/info/unicode/char/1f512/browsertest.htm)) into Atom.
2. Pressing backspace once, the unicode character is deleted, along with everything else up until the end of the string.
3. Pressing backspace a second time gets things back into the initial state.

What should happen: The state you get into in step 2 should not exist. Pressing backspace after pasting in the symbol should take you back to the pre-paste state.

data.title: Atom on OS X "canceled restart"
data.body:
If Atom is running and I choose Apple...Restart, the restart is always canceled.

![screenshot_5_31_13_11_55_am](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/60566/592428/45b232c0-ca1b-11e2-9cff-71a2b8430b88.png)

To reproduce:
1. Launch Atom; an empty Atom with no open buffers is fine.
2. Choose Restart from the Apple menu.

Atom quits immediately, but the system restart aborts and displays the above dialog.

Also, this acts like choosing Quit from the Atom menu, which means that if you have unsaved but modified buffers, you lose them without a confirmation (cc #492).

data.title: Blinding white flash when atom is loaded with dark theme
data.body: This change should fix this https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1373

data.title: Move TextMate bundles from submodules to package dependencies
Meta-t to index files can be cancelled
data.body:
If you hit meta-t, the file indexing kicks off. But if hit meta-t again to close the fuzzy finder, then hit it again, it'll start reindexing.

Expected: it keeps indexing in the background, or resumes where it left off. It should probably just index on startup, anyway.
